content: kitty in a gift box by muninn81 general ● us terminology ● rounds are worked in spiral do not join rounds with slip_stitch ● finished version will vary depending on yarn and hook size used materials ● yarn colors i used white for the cat head tail and feet then red for the majority of the gift box then green for a stripe on the box and the bow ● hook i used 6 0 mm abbreviations and stitches ● single_crochet = single_crochet ● magic_ring = magic_ring ● chain = chain ● half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet ● increase = increase = make 2 single_crochet in the same stitch ● decrease = decrease = 2 single_crochet together ● bpsc = back post single_crochet ● bphdc = back post half_double_crochet ● dec3bp = decrease using back post single_crochet over 3 stitches insert hook around back post draw up a loop do this three times over three stitches then yarn over and close the stitch ● dec3tog = decrease over three stitches = 3 single_crochet together i use the invisible decrease method insert hook into front loop of next three stitches pull up a loop yarn over and pull through both loops ● flo = front loop only ● 5dc bobble = 5 double_crochet bobble stitch yarn over pull up a loop yarn over and pull through first two loops on hook do this 3 times results in 4 loops on hook then yarn over and pull through all loops ● around = repeat the specified stitches until you reach the end of the round instructions ● i like to make the bow and tail first and then sew them on before closing the body bow / ribbons ● i used a version of the spiral bow idea from https
